events.title: Signing of the Treaty of Tordesillas
events.description: Spain and Portugal signed the Treaty of Tordesillas, dividing newly discovered lands outside Europe between them along a meridian 370 leagues west of the Cape Verde islands.
events.significance: This treaty had a profound impact on the colonization patterns of the Americas and shaped the linguistic and cultural map of the New World.

events.title: Louis XIV crowned King of France
events.description: Louis XIV was crowned in Reims Cathedral, beginning one of the longest reigns in European history which led to the consolidation of absolute monarchy in France.
events.significance: His reign influenced French culture, politics, and expansion, establishing France as a dominant European power in the 17th century.

events.title: End of the Siege of Khartoum
events.description: General Charles Gordon was killed when Mahdist forces captured Khartoum in Sudan, ending the siege that had lasted nearly a year.
events.significance: The event marked a key episode in British colonial history and influenced imperial policy in Africa.

events.title: Battle of Midway begins
events.description: The Battle of Midway commenced between the United States and Japan in the Pacific during World War II.
events.significance: It became a turning point in the Pacific Theater, stopping Japanese expansion and shifting the balance of naval power to the Allies.

events.title: US Navy shoots down an Iranian passenger plane
events.description: During the Iran-Iraq War, a US Navy gunboat downed an Iranian civilian airliner, resulting in significant international controversy.
events.significance: This incident highlighted the dangers of regional conflicts impacting civilians and strained US-Iran relations further.
